responses.content:
Here is the YAML object equivalent to the type LeadList, with the identified security vulnerabilities:

```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Improper Validation of Specified Quantity in Input
    analysis: |
      The codebase includes functions that accept user input without properly validating the quantity of the input. This could lead to vulnerabilities such as buffer overflows or other input-related issues.
    cwe: CWE-1284
    function_names:
      - init
      - setMDLv2000
    filenames:
      - src/main/js/MarvinJSViewer.js
      - src/main/js/MolPaintJSViewer.js
      - src/main/js/MarvinJSEditor.js
      - src/main/js/MolPaintJSEditor.js
      - src/main/js/OpenChemLibJSEditor.js
    classification: slightly promising

  - headline: Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
    analysis: |
      The codebase includes functions that handle user-supplied molecules in the MDL MOL format, which could be vulnerable to injection attacks if the input is not properly sanitized.
    cwe: CWE-1236
    function_names:
      - encodeViewerJS
      - encodeEditorJS
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/de/ipb_halle/molecularfaces/OpenChemLibJSRenderer.java
      - src/main/java/de/ipb_halle/molecularfaces/MarvinJSRenderer.java
    classification: slightly promising

  - headline: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
    analysis: |
      The codebase includes functions that execute external JavaScript resources, which could be vulnerable to OS command injection attacks if the input is not properly validated.
    cwe: CWE-78
    function_names:
      - addScriptExt
      - addCssExt
    filenames:
      - src/main/js/ResourcesLoader.js
      - src/main/java/de/ipb_halle/molecularfaces/MolPluginCore.java
    classification: slightly promising

  - headline: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
    analysis: |
      The codebase includes functions that handle user-supplied molecules in the MDL MOL format, which could be vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks if the input is not properly sanitized.
    cwe: CWE-79
    function_names:
      - escape
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/de/ipb_halle/molecularfaces/OpenChemLibJSRenderer.java
      - src/main/java/de/ipb_halle/molecularfaces/MarvinJSRenderer.java
    classification: slightly promising

  - headline: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
    analysis: |
      The codebase does not appear to include any functionality related to SQL queries or database interactions, so there is no immediate risk of SQL injection vulnerabilities.
    cwe: CWE-89
    function_names: []
    filenames: []
    classification: not promising

  - headline: Improper Encoding or Escaping of Output
    analysis: |
      The codebase includes functions that handle user-supplied molecules in the MDL MOL format, which could be vulnerable to output encoding issues if the output is not properly escaped.
    cwe: CWE-116
    function_names:
      - escape
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/de/ipb_halle/molecularfaces/OpenChemLibJSRenderer.java
      - src/main/java/de/ipb_halle/molecularfaces/MarvinJSRenderer.java
    classification: slightly promising

  - headline: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
    analysis: |
      The codebase includes functions that handle user input, which could be vulnerable to buffer-related issues such as buffer overflows or out-of-bounds reads/writes if the input is not properly validated.
    cwe: CWE-119
    function_names:
      - init
      - setMDLv2000
    filenames:
      - src/main/js/MarvinJSViewer.js
      - src/main/js/MolPaintJSViewer.js
      - src/main/js/MarvinJSEditor.js
      - src/main/js/MolPaintJSEditor.js
      - src/main/js/OpenChemLibJSEditor.js
    classification: slightly promising

  - headline: Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference
    analysis: |
      The codebase does not appear to include any functionality related to parsing or processing XML data, so there is no immediate risk of XML external entity (XXE) vulnerabilities.
    cwe: CWE-611
    function_names: []
    filenames: []
    classification: not promising

  - headline: Improper Neutralization of Argument Delimiters in a Command ('Argument Injection')
    analysis: |
      The codebase does not appear to include any functionality related to executing external commands with user-supplied arguments, so there is no immediate risk of argument injection vulnerabilities.
    cwe: CWE-88
    function_names: []
    filenames: []
    classification: not promising

  - headline: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an Expression Language Statement ('Expression Language Injection')
    analysis: |
      The codebase does not appear to include any functionality related to processing or executing expression language statements, so there is no immediate risk of expression language injection vulnerabilities.
    cwe: CWE-917
    function_names: []
    filenames: []
    classification: not promising

  - headline: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
    analysis: |
      The codebase does not appear to include any functionality related to dynamically generating or executing code, so there is no immediate risk of code injection vulnerabilities.
    cwe: CWE-94
    function_names: []
    filenames: []
    classification: not promising

  - headline: Inappropriate Encoding for Output Context
    analysis: |
      The codebase includes functions that handle user-supplied molecules in the MDL MOL format, which could be vulnerable to output encoding issues if the output is not properly escaped.
    cwe: CWE-838
    function_names:
      - escape
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/de/ipb_halle/molecularfaces/OpenChemLibJSRenderer.java
      - src/main/java/de/ipb_halle/molecularfaces/MarvinJSRenderer.java
    classification: slightly promising
